poem:
**Geminid Reverie**

In the vast fabric of night,  
a celestial embroidery unfolds—  
stitched by luminous needles  
of meteors across the dark.  
  
A brief flare of wonder  
pierces the blanket of sleep,  
as we step out onto lawns  
to taste the silence of the sky,  
counting our allotted whispers  
of light, destined to vanish  
before they find the ground.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. It has been known to produce more than 150 meteors an hour at its peak, although light pollution and other factors". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
